intro: Discocalyx vidalii, commonly known as the Vidal's discocarp, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive disc-shaped calyx that encases the flower, giving it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
